alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Crawford; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Richland; Trempealeau; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 10:56AM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Dangerous Winter Storm through Early Saturday... .The winds across parts of northeast Iowa and Grant County in southwest Wisconsin are expected to strengthen from mid to late afternoon and then continue through midnight. Sustained winds will range from 30 to 35 mph and wind gust will be as high as 45 mph. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility to near white out or blizzard conditions at times, especially in rural or open areas. Heavy snow will continue to fall south of a Charles City Iowa to Wisconsin Rapids line. Snow rates will be as high as 1 inch per hour at times, especially across northeast Iowa through southwest and central Wisconsin. Winds will increase later this afternoon leading to blowing and drifting in open areas. Travel will become hazardous for most of the region, potentially impossible where snowfall and winds are the highest. Consider altering, delaying or even canceling travel plans if conditions warrant it. Bitterly cold air arrives as this storm system exits the area with wind chills of 20 to 30 below by Saturday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 7 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Iowa, southeast Minnesota and central, southwest and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
